info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 7:27PM CDT until March 30 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CLAY AND LOWNDES COUNTIES... At 727 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Crawford, or 14 miles southeast of Starkville, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Bent Oak around 730 PM CDT. Waverly around 735 PM CDT. Columbus and Columbus AFB around 740 PM CDT. Steens and Kolola Springs around 745 PM CDT. Caledonia around 750 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Artesia. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
